title: How to improve my philosophical thinking - Quora

response.answer_text: There are a number of things you can do: Dispel the idea that there is ‘philosophical thinking’. There is just trained thinking that invokes a method, and then there is what lay persons do, which is something less than formal thinking.Dispel the myth that ‘better method’ will cure all. Most polemic failures arise, not from a lack of thinking methodology, but from a lack of subject knowledge. There is a lot to know, experiences to be had, perspectives to be understood. In the absence of that, logic, or awareness of logical fallacies, or syllogisms, is not going to help.Find a single philosopher that resonates with you, as ‘easy to learn’, as offering an integrated, coherent world view, with a lot of breadth, and master that person’s ideas, or that ‘schools’. Keep doing so until you find points of digression. When you find people, a particular school of thought that differs from ‘your school’ the most, then study that. Keep doing that, until you develop confidence in a world view.Now, it is hard to have confidence in one’s world view’ until you have applied it to the real world, so I’d next be looking at engaging with real people, in real life. i.e. Comments sections on world news articles. Facebook groups where you can debate, forums for philosophy. You are going to find that the biggest bone of contention, as stated, is not whether you know the popular logical fallacies, which is great, but whether you know something about history, science, human nature, finance, economics, psychology and law. If you didn’t previously integrate these subjects into your ‘world view’, then you are going to be making assumptions that will affect your understanding. In the absence of these subjects, particularly economics, finance and psychology, there is good reason to think you might be intellectual dishonest, just as a source of vulnerability, for the ‘sin of not needing these subjects before’, and not having the opportunity to learn them, and simply because society as a mob, hasn’t needed to learn them either.Truth is rare; don’t expect it to be popular. If you want to be able to think with efficacy, then it is not enough to be a master of methodology. I find it helpful to differentiate yourself from everyone. You won’t be liked; but you will be efficacious. Oh, and you will be an outcast. Most people don’t like to stand corrected. I think that’s the type of ‘intensity of engagement’ that is required to be an effective thinker. It has to be automatic. Self critical and critiquing everyone, everything you confront.

First category literature is called esoteric science or spiritual scriptures.It is also known as "New ideas"and they have generated not from "thinking"known to us,but from "seeing",the higher faculty operates only in presence of higher consciousness,all to gather unfamiliar to us.They are called "seers"& not writers.We,in presence of our average consciousness,understand what is "writings"& what do we mean by writers,but,as we lack higher consciousness,faculty of seeing is beyond our reach of understanding.If you study esoteric literature and if you meditate simultaneously,you can accentuate your philosophical thinking.As it comes from higher consciousness,for you it is necessary to raise your level of consciousness by meditation.To study philosophical literature from second category,simply study is enough,you don't need to meditate,as it comes from level of consciousness equal to you.Thanks.Q guru
